service.name: Ex-Carer Allowance (child) Health Care Card
service.description: Ex-Carer Allowance (child) Health Care Card (EHC) is a card issued to eligible ex-Carer Allowance (CA) (child) care receivers when they turn 16. A proportion of 15 year old care receivers whose disability or medical condition attracted Carer Allowance (CA) (child) for their carer will no longer qualify for a Health Care Card (HCC) once they turn 16, despite having the same condition and facing the same pharmaceutical costs.

Dimension.name: Carers
Dimension.desc: There are payments and services available if you provide daily care to someone with a severe disability or medical condition or someone who is frail aged.

Dimension.name: Centrelink
Dimension.desc: Delivering a range of payments and services for people at times of major change.

Dimension.name: Human Services
Dimension.desc: We deliver social and health-related payments and services
